page.title: 08SPECIAL RESIDENTIAL SCHOOL
page.content:
Dinsdale Park Special residential School which stands in 11 acres of grounds, was originally built in 1680 as a shooting lodge.
Various extensions and alterations have been made by owners of the property over the years, and when Durham County Council bought the house in 1919 for Â£30,000 it was converted into a residential school for mentally defective and deprived children.
Accommodation is available for 72 children of both sexes under the age of 12.
At this present time the school is underused and is facing the threat of closure
